article_title: Conservatives Reach Out to Latinos Ahead of 2016 Elections
article_text:
MESA, Ariz.— In an office building in this Phoenix suburb, an activist group is helping more than 100 Hispanic immigrants to learn English.

But it isn’t one of the usual left-leaning organizations involved in grass-roots Latino advocacy—it is the Libre Initiative, a group funded by the conservative donor network founded by Charles and David...

twitter.description: Libre, an activist group funded by the conservative donor network founded by Charles and David Koch, offers recent Hispanic immigrants practical services, while organizing them around free-market political ideas. The Koch network plans to spend about $750 million influencing the 2016 elections.
twitter.title: Conservatives Reach Out to Latinos Ahead of 2016 Elections

image.alt: Conservatives reach out to Latinos ahead of 2016 elections

twitter.creator: @AlejandroLazo
